snippet: Central to the effort by President Obama’s team to recover momentum is a renewed effort to win the three remaining debates, starting with Thursday’s vice-presidential face-off.
abstract: President Obama’s team is struggling to put his campaign back on track in a renewed effort to win the three remaining debates, starting with the face-off between Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr. and Rep Paul D Ryan; under the tutelage of David Axelrod, the president’s chief strategist who is personally overseeing the preparations, Biden will be coached on presenting an aggressive prosecution of the Republican ticket.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and TRIP GABRIEL

lead_paragraph: Central to the effort by President Obama’s team to recover momentum is a renewed effort to win the three remaining debates, starting with Thursday’s vice-presidential face-off.

headline.main: With Biden Up Next to Debate, Obama’s Aides Plot Comeback
headline.print_headline: Biden Up Next, Obama’s Aides Plot Comeback
